summary: Ecosystem Architecture explores the parallels between natural and non-natural organizati ons, emphasizing the move towards less hierarchical and more decentralized structures. The series examines the concept of ecosystems from biological, technological, and global perspectives, drawing connections between physical and virtual realms and reflecting on a pragmatic future of fragmented yet resilient systems.
excerpt: Ecosystem Architecture examines natural and non-natural organizational parallels, highlighting the shift toward decentralized structures. It discusses the fragmentation and resilience of these systems.
